review_text: If your looking for a great place to stay and enjoy the area, you need to stay at The Hideout at Old Saints Roost. Nik and Dusty kept us informed as soon as we booked the place. We were sent information about the place and detailed driving instructions since you do have to drive a ways into the neighborhood and there are limited lights if you are arriving at night. This is actually one of the things we loved about the area. At night you can enjoy nature with the sights and sounds of the country. The sitting area on the porch at night is perfect for star gazing and in the morning/evening for watching the deer and birds. Nik and Dusty have thought of everything by leaving deer corn to feed the deer, cookies for a snack upon your arrival, water, juice and breakfast for the morning, and everything in place for you to just settle in and enjoy yourselves. They even leave a binder with details about the place, things to do in the area and information about the area. We explored and took hikes to see the lake, which parts have dried up due to the drought. If you like to look for shells you can walk out onto the dried up lake bed and find some great ones. The price is also worth it with all the extras that you get and you have the entire house and patio area to enjoy your stay and especially considering the cost of the hotels in the area. The place is quiet and there are few neighbors to interrupt your stay. You won't regret choosing this place. We definitely will be back whenever we are in the area.
